info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 08 at 4:18PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort and Colleton. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beaufort, Port Royal, Clarendon, Ladys Island, Beaufort Marine Corps Air Station, Dale, Burton, Laurel Bay, Shell Point, Parris Island, Chesterfield, Daniels, Walling Grove, Sams Point, Ashdale, Coosaw Island, Chisolm Point, Beaufort County Airport, Dataw Island and Beaufort Memorial Hospital.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
